reasoning: Intervertebral disc disorder is measured as prevalence (chronic condition affecting existing population) rather than incidence. Global prevalence estimate ~7.5% (750 per 100k) based on epidemiological studies, including symptomatic and clinically significant cases with age-related degenerative changes.
source: Modic MT, Ross JS. (2007). Lumbar degenerative disk disease. Radiology. 245(1):43-61. Combined with epidemiological prevalence estimates from multiple cohort studies (approximately 5-15% symptomatic, 30-60% radiographic).
